critique: The document is an executive order from 1933 standardizing salaries across various government agencies created during the New Deal era. It aims to ensure uniformity in compensation for similar work, giving the executive branch significant control over wage setting in these agencies. The order also includes provisions for adjusting existing salaries to comply with the new schedule, with some exceptions for employees who were reinstated or transferred from other government establishments. The document reflects a strong role for the federal government in managing the economy and workforce during the Great Depression.
